The music builds as he steps behind the Judge-- his razor ready -- we are sure the great moment has come -- the mus still builds -- Todd finally puts the razor at the Judge' throat-- Then-- With an easy flick of his wrist, he just begins to shave Judge, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women... Fascinating... Sipping coffee, Dancing...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pretty women Are a wonder. Pretty women. Sitting in the window or Standing on the stair, Something in them Cheers the air. Pretty women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silhouetted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay within you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glancing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathing lightly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women! Blowing out their candles or Combing out their hair... They sing simultaneously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they leave... Even when they leave you And vanish, they somehow Can still remain There with you, There with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even when they leave, They still Are there. They're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Pretty women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At their mirrors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In their gardens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letter-writing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flower-picking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weather-watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How they make a man sing! Proof of heaven As you're living-- Pretty women, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music approaches a feverish crescendo as Todd prepare finally kill the Judge and they sing simultaneously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty   women, yes! Pretty   women, sir! Pretty   women! Pretty   women, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women, here's to Pretty women, all the Pretty women--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the music reaches a climax, Todd raises his arm i huge arc and is about to slash the Judge's throat when-- Suddenly-- Anthony bursts in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Todd! I've seen Johanna! She said she'll leave with me tonight--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge jumps up, away from Todd--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! -- There is indeed a higher power to warn me thus in time--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears off the sheet as he advances savagely on Anthony

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna elope with you? Deceiving slut! -- I'll lock her up in some obscure retreat where neither you nor any other vile creature shall ever lay eyes on her again--! He spins with venom to Todd:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as for you, barber, it is all too clear what company you keep. Service them well and hold their custom -- for you'll have none of mine. He strides out. Todd stands, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Todd -- you have to help me -- I've talked to Johanna and--! Todd suddenly turns on him with a ferocious ROAR:

dialogues.speaker: OUT
dialogues.text: Utterly stunned at his friend's ferocity, Anthony backs a leaves the shop. Music begins, very agitated, as Todd stands motionless. In shock. His mind cracking apart. Mrs. Lovett hurries in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this shouting and running about, what's happened--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him -- and then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sailor busted in, I know, I saw them both running down the street and I said-- Todd interrupts wildly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him! His throat was bare Beneath my hand--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, there, dear. Don't fret--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spins on her violently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I had him! His throat was there, And he'll never come again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy now. Hush, love, hush. I keep telling you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your rush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I wait? You told me to wait! Now he'll never come again... The music becomes ferocious as Todd's wrenching insanity, always close to the surface, finally explodes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hole in the world Like a great black pit And it's filled with people Who are filled with shit And the vermin of the world Inhabit it-- But not for long! He suddenly looks to Mrs. Lovett -- she starts back -- alarmed by the pure madness in his eyes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all deserve to die! Tell you why, Mrs. Lovett, Tell you why: Because in all of the whole human race, Mrs. Lovett There are two kinds of men and only two. There's the one staying put In his proper place

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And the one with his foot In the other one's face-- Look at me, Mrs. Lovett, Look at you-- He suddenly lurches and grabs Mrs. Lovett tightly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we all deserve to die! Even you, Mrs. Lovett, Even I. Because the lives of the wicked should be-- (slashes at the air violently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made brief. For the rest of us, death Will be a relief-- We all deserve to die! He clutches her to him very tightly as he suddenly keens, howl of pure agony:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll never see Johanna, No, I'll never hug my girl to me-- He hurls Mrs. Lovett away from him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished! We suddenly slash to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --In Todd's mind. We are moving with him as he stalks relentlessly, holding razor, striding down a busy street like a tiger. The many pedestrians he passes don't even notice him. He invisible to them, a wolf among the sheep, as he beckons-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! You, sir, How about a shave? Come and visit Your good friend, Sweeney--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd continues to stride, beckoning to another man:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, sir, too, sir-- Welcome to the grave! I will have vengeance, I will have salvation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd continues to stride, beckoning to another man:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, sir? You, sir? No one's in the chair-- Come on, come on, Sweeney's waiting! I want you bleeders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd continues to stride, beckoning to another man:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, sir -- anybody! Gentlemen, now don't be shy! Not one man, no, Nor ten men, Nor a hundred Can assuage me-- I will have you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd continues to prowl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will get him back Even as he gloats. In the meantime I'll practice On less honorable throats--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd suddenly falls to his knees, keening in anguish--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my Lucy lies in ashes And I'll never see my girl again, But the work waits, I'm alive at last

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (a final exalted cry) And I'm full of JOOOOOOY!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his razor high on the soaring last note as we p back ... our view is suddenly obscured by a strange, fren fluttering of black wings ... We continue to pull back .. discover the black wings are pigeons, thousands of them, flying up in a great cloud... We continue to pull back to finally discover that Todd is kneeling in the heart of a church square... Empty but for him. As his cry ends we slash back to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Todd is kneeling, sweat pouring through his clothes, panting for air. Mrs. Lovett stands, looking down at him intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all very well, but what are we going to do about -- (kicks the chest) -- the dear departed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd remains kneeling, motionless. She goes to him, firm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! Do you hear me? Get a hold of yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps his cheek -- he looks up at her, barely seeing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you great useless thing, come on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hauls him up and drags him out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thumps down, still in his own dark world. She quickly glances around for Toby and then goes into he parlor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She discovers Toby is asleep on the sofa before the fire. She quickly snatches up a bottle of gin from the sideboar and returns to the pie shop...

dialogues.speaker: INT. PIE SHOP DAY
dialogues.text: She pours Todd a tumbler of gin, hands it to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, drink it down -- all the way -- that's right ... (he does so)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now, we got a body molderin' away upstairs, what do you intend we should do about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later on, when it's dark, we'll take him to some secret place and bury him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, of course, we could do that. I don't suppose he's got any relatives going to come poking around looking for him... A chord of music. A beat. An idea. He looks at her uncomprehendingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know me, sometimes bright ideas just pop right into my head, and I keep thinking... Seems a downright shame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems an awful waste... Such a nice plump frame Wot's-his-name Has... Had... Has... Nor it can't be traced. Business needs a lift-- Debts to be erased-- Think of it as thrift,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As a gift... If you get my drift... (Todd has no idea what she is talking about) No? (She sighs) Seems an awful waste. I mean, With the price of meat what it is, When you get it, If you get it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd suddenly understands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, you got it. (She warms to the idea) Take, for instance, Mrs. Mooney and her pie shop. Business never better, using only Pussycats and toast. And a pussy's good for maybe six or Seven at the most. And I'm sure they can't compare As far as taste--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett, What a charming notion,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music builds as they sing simultaneously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eminently practical and yet Appropriate as always. Mrs. Lovett, how I've lived without you All these years I'll never know! How delectable! Also undetectable. How choice! How rare!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it does seem a Waste... It's an idea... Think about it... Lots of other gentlemen'll Soon be coming for a shave,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Won't they? Think of All them Pies! A triumphant waltz theme begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what's the sound of the world out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Mr. Todd, What, Mr. Todd, What is that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those crunching noises pervading the air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Todd, Yes, Mr. Todd, Yes, all around--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's man devouring man, my dear, They sing simultaneously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who are we To deny it in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who are we To deny it in here? Music continues under:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, these are desperate times, Mrs. Lovett, and desperate measures are called for. She goes to the counter and comes back with an imaginary

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are now, hot out of the oven... She holds the imaginary pie out to him with a sly and wic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's priest. Have a little priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it really good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, it's too good, At least. Then again, they don't commit sins of the flesh, So it's pretty fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awful lot of fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only where it sat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you got poet Or something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you see the trouble with poet Is, how do you know it's Deceased? Try the priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("tasting" it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Heavenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as hearty as bishop, perhaps, but not as bland as curate, either. Mrs. Lovett presents another imaginary pie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawyer's rather nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's for a price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order something else, though, to follow, Since no one should swallow It twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything that's lean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, if you're British and loyal, You might enjoy Royal Marine. Anyway, it's clean. Though, of course, it tastes of wherever it's been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking past her to imaginary oven)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that squire On the fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy no, sir, Look closer, You'll notice it's grocer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks thicker. More like vicar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it has to be grocer -- it's green. Todd laughs as the glorious waltz theme returns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The history of the world, my love--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save a lot of graves, Do a lot of relatives favors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Is those below serving those up above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody shaves, So there should be plenty of flavors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How gratifying for once to know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating barber shop above)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --That those above will serve those down below! The music continues under:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since marine doesn't appeal to you, how about rear admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too salty. I prefer general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With or without his privates? -- "With" is extra. Todd chortles as Mrs. Lovett offers another pie with a particular, flamboyant panache:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fop. Finest in the shop. Or we have some shepherd's pie peppered With actual shepherd On top. And I've just begun. Here's a politician -- so oily It's served with a doily-- Have one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on a bun. (She looks at him quizzically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you never know if it's going to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the friar. Fried, it's drier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the clergy is really Too coarse and too mealy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then actor-- That's compacter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and always arrives overdone. (he is suddenly dark and purposeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come again when you Have Judge on the menu... The music vamps deliciously as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True, we don't have Judge -- yet -- but would you settle for the next best thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? She offers him a butcher's cleaver:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Executioner. He takes the cleaver, feels the heft of it. Feels good. Then he picks up her wooden rolling pin, hands it to her, the music builds into the triumphant waltz:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have charity towards the world, my pet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, I know, my love--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take the customers that we can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-born and low, my love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll not discriminate great from small. No, we'll serve anyone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll serve anyone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to anyone At all! The music builds to a climax as they joyously brandish th "weapons. "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, white hands ... removing some clothes from a drawe ... putting them into a portmanteau ... locking the case. Johanna, wearing traveling clothes, is packing to leave w a voice surprises her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's true. She turns. The Judge stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir ... A gentlemen knocks before entering a lady's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed he does ... But I see no lady. He enters, dangerously quiet. And terrifically hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told myself the sailor was lying ... I told myself this was a cruel fiction ... That my Johanna would never betray me. Never hurt me so. He moves toward her. She stands her ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir ... I will leave this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that only appropriate. Since you no longer find my company to your liking, madam, we shall provide you with new lodgings. He stands very close to her. Still she holds her ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until this moment I have spared the rod ... And the ungrateful child has broken my heart. Now you will learn discipline... The large form of the Beadle fills the doorway. She glanc to him, disquieted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you have learned to appreciate what you have, perhaps we shall meet again. Until then ... Think on your sins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to the Beadle -- the Beadle surges forward and gr Johanna brutally-- She screams and fights like a tiger -- to no avail-- The Beadle covers her mouth with one of his huge hands an hauls her out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony is racing toward the front of mansion when he see A hansom cab is just pulling away -- Johanna's terrified looking at him through the window--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANNA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony sees the Beadle pulling her away from the window the carriage clatters off-- Judge Turpin stands on the steps of the mansion -- Anthon goes to him in a murderous rage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking her?! Tell me or I swear by God--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge spins and roars -- a hellish howl that echoes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOULD YOU KILL ME, BOY?! HERE I STAND!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony's eyes burn into the Judge -- but he is no killer He turns and races after the hansom cab. It rounds a corn and is gone. The Judge watches as Anthony pursues the cab, disappearin around the corner. And we fade to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The face of the Beggar Woman.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She sits, crouched on her haunches, peering up from under few greasy locks of hair. She is watching something intently. A few pedestrians mov quickly down the sidewalk past her, excited. They chatter back and forth eagerly... The Beggar Woman uncoils and follows... And we finally see what the Beggar Woman has been watchin intently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett's wretched establishment has been transformed She has created a modest outdoor eating garden with table surrounded by glowing Chinese lanterns. A fresh coat of paint, a few bushes in pots and birds in cages add to the feeling of upward mobility. A new sign hangs proudly over the entrance to the pie sho "MRS. LOVETT'S WORLD FAMOUS MEAT PIES!" And then in small letters: "LIKE MOTHER USED TO MAKE." The eating garden is already crowded, the benches at the tables are filled and other customers stand and mill abou All eating, eating, eating... ...The most delicious looking meat pies you could ever imagine. Crispy crust. Thick, luxurious gravy. Tart and t meat. The customers take great, hungry mouthfuls; the steaming gravy oozing down greedy faces. Chomp. Chomp. Chomp. The Beggar Women stands across the street, ravenously hun She finally gets the nerve to approach when-- Toby -- wearing a spiffy new outfit with apron -- bursts the shop and circulates through the customers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, May I have your attention, perlease? Are your nostrils aquiver and tingling as well At that delicate, luscious ambrosial smell? Yes they are, I can tell...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He moves through the greedily eating customers in the out garden and toward the street as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ladies and gentlemen, That aroma enriching the breeze Is like nothing compared to its succulent source, As the gourmets among you will tell you, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arrives at the street and drums up some more business:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, You can't imagine the rapture in store-- (Indicating the pie shop) Just inside of this door! There you'll sample Mrs. Lovett's meat pies, Savory and sweet pies, As you'll see. You who eat pies, Mrs. Lovett's meat pies Conjure up the treat pies Used to be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Mrs. Lovett sweeps from the pie shop with a tra hot, steaming pies. Like her shop, she has been transformed as well. She wear her somewhat gauche notion of a "fancy dress." Buckets of decolletage. And her hair has been dyed a rather unique aubergine color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming! (pushing past a customer) 'Scuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating a beckoning customer) Ale there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, mum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, now!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The customers suddenly exclaim their joy through awkward mouthfuls of pie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that's good! Toby scurries inside to get a jug of ale, whisks back out starts filling tankards as Mrs. Lovett circulates grandly She is a bundle of activity -- serving pies, collecting money, giving orders, addressing the patrons individually with equal buoyant insincerity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, dearie... How have you been keeping?... Cor, me bones is weary! Toby--! (Indicating a Customer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One for the gentleman... Hear the birdies cheeping-- Helps to keep it cheery... She spots the Beggar Woman approaching and responds with unusual ferocity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby! Throw the old woman out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that's good! Toby shoos the Beggar Woman away, but she soon comes skul back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to customers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your pleasure, dearie?... No, we don't cut slices... Cor, me eyes are bleary!... (As Toby is about to pour for a drunken customer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby! None for the gentleman!... I could up me prices-- I'm a little leery... Business Couldn't be better, though--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock on wood. She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music continues as Todd works busily. Sawing, drilling, screwing, hammering. Doing something we cannot see to his barber chair. Making adjustments, tinkering, building, feverish. Happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett continues to circulate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your pleasure, dearie? (Spilling ale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops! I beg your pardon! Just me hands is smeary-- (Spotting a freeloader trying to sneak out without paying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby! Run for the gentleman! Toby catches him, collects the money, as Mrs. Lovett turn another customer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you love a garden? Always makes me teary... (Looking back at the freeloader)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be one them foreigners--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that's good that is delicious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my secret? (To a woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, dear -- forgive my candor-- Family secret, All to do with herbs. Things like being Careful with your coriander, That's what makes the gravy grander--! The customers are getting more rabid now -- stuffing in t gorgeous meat pies in great fistfuls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More hot pies! More hot! More pies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music continues as Todd makes the final adjustments to hi chair. He stands back. Seems delighted with the results o his tinkering. The ratty old parlor chair has been transformed into a sleek, Victorian barber chair -- with unique refinements. He leaves the barber shop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd stands at the top of the stairs, watching the street hungrily. As, below, Mrs. Lovett smiles to another custom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incidentally, dearie, You know Mrs. Mooney. Sales've been so dreary-- (She spots the Beggar Woman again) Toby! (Continuing to the customer, about Mrs. Mooney) --Poor thing is penniless. (Indicating Beggar Woman to Toby) What about that loony? (To the customer as Toby shoos the Beggar Woman away again) Lookin' sort of beery-- Oh, well, got her comeuppance-- (Hawklike, to a rising customer) And that'll be thruppence -- and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God that's good that is de have you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Licious ever tasted smell such Oh my God what more that's pies good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat them slow and Feel the crust, how thin I (she) rolled it! Eat them slow, 'cos Every one's a prize! Eat them slow, 'cos That's the lot and now we've sold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up a "Sold Out" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again tomorrow--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots a man in need of a shave approaching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More hot pies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless my eyes--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the man going up to the barber shop. Todd is sti standing at the top of the stairs. He smiles secretly to Lovett as he ushers the man in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh supplies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man goes into the barber shop as she happily takes do the "Sold Out" sign and turns again to the customers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it, dearie? (expecting more pies) Be here in a twinkling! Just confirms me theory-- Toby--! God watches over us. Didn't have an inkling... Positively eerie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneous with above) Is that a pie Fit for a king, A wondrous sweet And most delectable Thing? You see, ma'am, why There is no meat pie--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneous with above)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yum! Yum! Yum! Yum! Yum! Yum! Mrs. Lovett then spots the Beggar Woman approaching again she spins to Toby with truly shocking viciousness:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby! Throw the old woman out! Mrs. Lovett watches intently as Toby leads the Beggar Wom away. The Customers, meanwhile, are building to a pure frenzy o mastication -- chewing and gulping and snapping at the heavenly pies:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that's good that is de have you Licious ever tasted smell such Oh my God what perfect more that's Pies such flavor God, that's good!! The music comes to a rousing conclusion as Mrs. Lovett st at the door to her shop. Triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd is alone. He sits in the barber chair, smoking a pip He is holding an old Daguerreotype; creased, stained and bleached-out. The image shows his wife, Lucy, smiling and holding Baby Johanna. The child's features are almost completely obscu by a stain on the picture. He looks at it deeply. Then church bells echo in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The church bells continue as we discover Anthony, searching through the streets for Johanna. We see him in shot as he moves through the contours of the city.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts his search in a luxurious area of wealth. His journey through the city will take him lower and lower, i the darkest corners of London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel you, Johanna, I feel you. Do they think that walls can hide you? Even now I'm at your window. I am in the dark beside you, Buried sweetly in your yellow hair, Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Todd gazes quietly at the Daguerreotype:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna... And are you beautiful and pale, With yellow hair, like her? I'd want you beautiful and pale, The way I've dreamed you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We see the figure of Anthony, walking along the docks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Todd shaves a customer. We recognize the customer instantly: it is the GENTLEMAN. The Daguerreotype now rest on the counter. Todd remains wistful, detached, dream-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you're beautiful, what then, With yellow hair, like wheat? I think we shall not meet again-- (He quietly slits the Gentleman's throat) My little dove, my sweet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We see the figure of Anthony, walking past hanging carcasses of the busy meat market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll steal you, Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The dead Gentleman is slumped in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Johanna, You're gone, and yet you're mine. I'm fine, Johanna, I'm fine! He pulls a lever on the newly adjusted chair -- the chair becomes a slide -- and the Gentleman disappears through a trapdoor in the floor, down a chute -- Todd pulls the lev again and the chair returns to its normal position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We see Anthony moving past a crowded tenement, redolen cholera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Music continues as Mrs. Lovett descends a long and ver claustrophobic series of steps down to the bakehouse. She unbolts and pulls aside a heavy iron door and enters. We remain outside. A fiery red glow spills out -- the roa the oven within is thundering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Beggar Woman stands on Fleet Street. The hellish metropolis glows, the smoke from a thousand chimneys crea a great pall over the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a demented rage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke! Smoke!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sign of the devil! Sign of the devil! City on fire! (to disgusted passers-by) Witch! Witch! Smell it, sir! An evil smell! Every night at the vespers bell-- Smoke that comes from the mouth of hell-- City on fire! City on fire... (She begins to scuttle off) Mischief! Mischief! Mischief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The red glow of sunset fills the shop as Todd ushers i another customer and prepares to shave him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I never hear your voice, My turtledove, my dear, I still have reason to rejoice: The way ahead is clear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We see the figure of Anthony moving down a dark alley. Shadowy figures lurk along the alley walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel you... Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Todd continues to prepare to shave the customer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in that darkness when I'm blind With what I can't forget-- It's always morning in my mind, My little lamb, my pet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We see Anthony moving past an lonely graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay, Johanna... (He quietly cuts the customer's throat) The way I've dreamed you are. (Todd notices dusk outside the window) Oh look, Johanna-, (Pulls the lever and the customer disappears) A star! (Tossing the customer's hat down the chute) A shooting star!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anthony continues to move past the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buried sweetly in your yellow hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Music continues as Mrs. Lovett emerges from the bakeho with a rack of hot pies. She walks out of frame, up the steps, as we push in on th crack in the door. The fiery roar of the oven within is overpowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Beggar Woman is scuttling madly along Fleet Street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the smoke over rooftops) There! There! Somebody, somebody look up there! (the passers-by continue to ignore her) Didn't I tell you? Smell that air? City on fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She approaches the pie shop, the agitated music matching increasing frenzy. She grabs a stunned Toby -- who is carrying some packages toward the pie shop:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Quick, sir! Run and tell! Warn 'em all of the witch's spell! There it is, there it is, the unholy smell! Tell it to the Beadle and the police as well! Tell 'em! Tell 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots Mrs. Lovett emerging from the pie shop and expl in desperation, pointing madly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!!! Fiend!!! City on fire!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby pulls away from her, as she begins to scuttle off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City on fire... Mischief ... Mischief ... Mischief... Fiend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She appeals to other pedestrians as she goes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alms! ... Alms! ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby turns to consider the horrible black smoke belching the chimney of the pie shop. Something about the foul, eb smoke troubles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Todd is standing alone, contemplative, slowly and methodically stropping his razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And though I'll think of you, I guess, Until the day I die, I think I miss you less and less As every day goes by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We see the figure of Anthony trudging past the siniste opium dens and depraved taverns of the East End.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Todd completes shaving a customer. The customer's wife daughter are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'd be beautiful and pale, And look too much like her. If only angels could prevail, We'd be the way we were. Johanna... The customer pays. With a pleasant smile, Todd ushers the out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anthony wanders past the high and impenetrable walls o madhouse, the demented souls within can be seen moving ab in silhouette behind barred windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel you... Johanna... Something makes him stop. He turns to consider the asylum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Todd shaves another customer. A beautiful morning outs the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, Johanna! Another bright red day! (He slits the customer's throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We learn, Johanna, To say... Goodbye... As the note continues, he pulls the lever and the custome disappears down the chute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anthony stares up at the asylum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll steal you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...As the music concludes, Todd picks up the faded Daguerreotype and again sits in his barber chair. He gazes at the picture, lost in revery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett and Todd rest on a picnic blanket, just like other couple out enjoying the fine day. The remains of a nice picnic lunch are scattered around t and Toby can be seen flying a kite a bit away. Mrs. Lovett watches happy couples moving about ... dogs a kids running hither and yon ... military officers squirin their ladies ... nurses with prams... Todd is distinctly ill at ease, brooding, as she chatters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... which is not to say we couldn't get some nice taxidermy animals to bring a touch of gentility to the place. You know, a boar's head or two... (glancing at the unresponsive Todd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. T., are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what did I just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back in his somber reflections)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a way to the Judge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloody old Judge! Always harping on the bloody old Judge! (she massages his neck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a nice respectable business now, money coming in regular and -- since we're careful to pick and choose -- only strangers and such like wot won't be missed -- who's going to catch on?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No response from Todd. She leans across and pecks him on cheek:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, Mr. Todd-- (Kisses him again) I'm so happy-- (Again) I could-- (Again) Eat you up, I really could! You know what I'd like to Do, Mr. Todd? (Kisses him) What I dream-- (Again) If the business stays as good, Where I'd really like to go-- (No response) In a year or so... (No response) Don't you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (couldn't care less) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forces a pained smile) Yes, yes, I do, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music continues as she leans back comfortably, beginn to imagine a wonderful, domestic future...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always had this dream of living at the seaside ... I got a picture postcard from me Aunt Nettie once. Oh, it seems like such a grand place... (notes Toby flying his kite) And all that fresh aquatic air's bound to be good for the lad's poxy lungs... By the sea, Mr. Todd, That's the life I covet; By the sea, Mr. Todd, Ooh, I know you'd love it! You and me, Mr. T., We could be alone

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In a house wot we'd almost own Down by the sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't that be smashing? And we go to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...In Mrs. Lovett's mind. She and Todd sit in the exact same positions as in Hampst Heath. Only now they are sitting on a beach. They are wearing what she imagines as fashionable seaside bathing clothes. Toby, who is not consumptively pale but overly rosy-cheek in her fantasy, is building a sandcastle nearby. Mrs. Lovett is sitting with her Dream Todd, of course, so has a bland smile on his face. Somewhat unnatural. In fact, there is something vaguely unreal and stilted ab all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the sea at our gate, We'll have kippered herring Wot have swum to us straight From the Straits of Bering. Every night in the kip When we're through our kippers, I'll be there slippin' off your slippers By the sea... With the fishies splashing. By the sea... Wouldn't that be smashing? Down by the sea--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say, Anything you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett strolls with Todd on a boardwalk. Artificiall lovely couples, like rotogravure magazine pictures, move about. Toby runs along ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see us waking, The breakers breaking, The seagulls squawking: Hoo! Hoo! I do me baking, Then I go walking With yoo-hoo... (she waves to Toby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoo-hoo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett and Todd recline on comfortable deck chairs, having tea and scones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll warm me bones On the esplanade Have tea and scones With me gay young blade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett's notion of a fashionable little seaside cott Crushing in its bourgeois blandness. She is making Toby try on a sweater. Todd is writing a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll knit a sweater While you write a letter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on the beach, she cuddles into Todd:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Coyly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we got better To do-hoo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett and Todd snuggle into bed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think how snug it'll be Underneath our flannel When it's just you and me And the English Channel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett and Todd entertain some unnaturally jolly chu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our cozy retreat, Kept all neat and tidy, We'll have chums over every Friday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say... Toby pulls Mrs. Lovett over to examine his little sandcas as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you love the weather By the sea? We'll grow old together By the seaside, (Beckons to Todd to join them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo! Hoo! By the beautiful sea! Music continues as Todd joins them. He kneels with Toby t help him work on the sandcastle. Mrs. Lovett stands, watc them, the picture of the doting mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be so quiet That who'll come by it Except a seagull? Hoo! Hoo! We shouldn't try it,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Though, till it's legal, For two-hoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett and Todd getting married. This being her fant after all, she wears white. Todd is in a constricting mor coat with a rakish top hat. Toby, the best man, watches proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a seaside wedding Could be devised, Me rumpled bedding Legitimized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange vows and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eyelids'll flutter, I'll turn into butter, The moment I mutter "I do-hoo!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett is placing a plate of kippers on the table am a proper English breakfast. A guest stands, leaning again wall, waiting to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the sea, in our nest, We could share our kippers With the odd paying guest From the weekend trippers, Have a nice sunny suite For the guest to rest in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark shape quickly moves past the guest -- Todd -- then guest slides down the wall -- a splash of blood on the wallpaper-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now and then, you could do the guest in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the beach, Mrs. Lovett, Todd and Toby sit comfortably. Watching an unnaturally gorgeous sunset. A picture postcard of a happy family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the sea. Married nice and proper, By the sea-- Bring along your chopper To the seaside, Hoo! Hoo! By the beautiful sea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music concludes as she throws her arms affectionately around her two men. We cut back to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Mrs. Lovett is sitting in the exact same position with Todd. Silence. Her smiles fades as she considers him. The grim, brooding reality is so clear next to her lovely dream. She watches him in silence as we fade to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd is standing at his usual post, the window, gazing intently down at Fleet Street. Mrs. Lovett enters with a tray of food:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought you some breakfast, dear, farm fresh eggs and a dollop of lovely clotted cream, only the best for my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops when he realizes he isn't even listening to her Her heart sinks seeing him at the window, wearing his obsession like a cloak. A beat as she looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. T., might I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not turning) Mm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did your Lucy look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me ... (a beat) ... Can't really remember can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had yellow hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the window. Mrs. Lovett proceeds with great sincerity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to leave all this behind you now. She's gone ... You keep looking down into the grave, you're never gonna look up. And life will just pass right by ... Life is for the alive, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have a life we two ... Maybe not like I dreamed, maybe not like you remember ... But we could get by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. He finally turns from the window. Almost as if to leave h demons behind... She smiles quietly and holds out her hand... She begins to cross to him...

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY REVEALING--
dialogues.text: The Gentleman! Standing right behind Mrs. Lovett-- He is glaring at Todd, relentless and accusatory-- Blood pouring from his throat-- A shocking horror movie vision--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then the bell rings outside the shop ... Todd turns ... t Gentleman is gone ... we hear footsteps climbing the stairs... Mrs. Lovett remains standing, her hand out to him, as-- Anthony enters, absolutely exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Todd ... Mrs. Lovett, ma'am ... (sinks into a chair) ... Seems I've not slept in a week -- but it's done--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Anthony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has her locked in a madhouse. Todd's head snaps to Anthony, riveted:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've found Johanna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all the good it'll do -- it's impossible to get to her. Todd begins pacing, the tiger again, his mind is racing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A madhouse ... A madhouse ... Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fogg's Asylum. But I've circled the place a dozen times. There's no way in. It's a fortress. Anthony fades to a brooding silence as Todd continues pac thinking, thinking. Mrs. Lovett watches him, concerned. Todd suddenly stops... We see him settling into an inspired sort of calm, as if can finally see the Promised Land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Todd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anthony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got her ... Where do you suppose all the wigmakers of London go to obtain their human hair? Bedlam. They get their hair from the lunatics at Bedlam--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand-- Todd suddenly grabs Anthony and hauls him up -- holds him close, forehead to forehead -- his whispered intensity tr disturbing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shall set you up as a wigmaker in search of hair -- that will gain you access -- then you will take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not be deterred -- You will slaughter the world -- To bring her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Mrs. Lovett watches, troubled, as Todd embraces Anthony closely. He holds him for a long beat. Then Todd is all action, hurries to get some money and gi it to Anthony, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go and outfit yourself properly -- you are to be a gentlemen wigmaker. When you return we shall dispatch a letter to this Mr. Fogg announcing your arrival. Go -- quickly now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clasping Todd's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Todd -- how can I ever--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Anthony hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Todd immediately hurls himself into a chair and begins writing a letter, his violent scrawl slashing across the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear, I wonder if--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fetch the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think it's time you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fetch the boy. Mrs. Lovett goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett begins going down the stairs outside the barb shop. Then she stops. She stands for a long moment, disturbed t Todd's demons are again devouring him. She looks down and sees Toby washing the tables in the outdoor garden. Toby is serious about his work, vigorousl scrubbing the tables with soap and water. She watches him for a moment and then continues down the steps:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby ... Mr. Todd requires you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes'm. He goes up the steps. She just stands, deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd is finishing the letter as Toby enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. T.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still writing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where the Old Bailey is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, sir. Not that I ever--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts, folding up letter) Take this there and seek out a Judge Turpin. Repeat that. Repeat that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the Old Bailey. Find Judge Turpin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him letter) Put this into his hands. Only to him. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, and while I'm out do you mind if I stop by the grocer and pick up the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd pounces like a panther-- He suddenly leaps up and grabs Toby by the throat with shocking brutality--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T CHATTER, BOY! You are not to stop! You are not to speak! You are to deliver this letter! DO YOU UNDERSTAND?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby is stunned and terrified. It is the first time he ha seen this side of his friend, Mr. Todd. Todd releases him. Toby races out. Todd immediately begins pacing like a caged animal, back forth, back and forth, whispering to himself neurotically day becomes evening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby walks back to the pie shop, upset. He stops when he sees Todd at the window above, unblinkin gazing like a falcon into the street. He continues on to Mrs. Lovett, who is clearing up the remains of a meal in the outdoor garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been, lad? We had quite the luncheon rush! Me poor bones is ready to drop... (She looks at him, notes his dark expression.) What is it, Toby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits. She sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Todd sent me on an errand ... And on the way back I went by the workhouse. And I was thinkin' ... But for you I would be there now. Or someplace worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like the Good Lord sent you for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, love, I feel quite the same way--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear me out, mum ... You know there's nothing I wouldn't do for you. Say, if there was someone around -- someone bad -- only you didn't know it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) What is this? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's gonna harm you, Not while I'm around. Nothing gonna harm you, No, sir, Not while I'm around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "someone bad"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demons are prowling Everywhere Nowadays. I'll send 'em howling,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I don't care-- I got ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, hush now, there's no need for this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's gonna hurt you, No one's gonna dare. Others can desert you-- Not to worry-- Whistle, I'll be there. Demons'll charm you With a smile For a while, But in time Nothing can harm you, Not while I'm around. Music continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this foolishness now? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little things wot I been thinking ... About Mr. Todd... Not to worry, not to worry, I may not be smart but I ain't dumb. I can do it, Put me to it, Show me something I can overcome. Not to worry, mum. He leans into her, she puts her arms around him, but her expression is deeply troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being close and being clever Ain't like being true, I don't need to, I won't never Hide a thing from you, Like some. Music continues as she nervously comforts him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Toby dear, haven't we had enough of this foolish chatter? ...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MRS. LOVETT (cont'd) (reaching for her purse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Here, how about I give you a shiny new penny and you can fetch us some nice toffees--? She pulls Pirelli's chatelaine purse from her dress--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Signor Pirelli's purse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, love -- this is just something Mr. T. give me for my birthday--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that proves it -- what I been thinkin'-- (He stands, urgently pulling her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go, ma'am, right now -- we gotta find the Beadle and get the law here-- She pulls him down to her again, agitated, her mind racin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush now, Toby, hush ... Here, you just sit next to me nice and quiet ... (calming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How could you think such a thing of Mr. Todd, who's been so good to us? He calms down a bit as she holds him. And she comes to a painful, dreadful decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's gonna harm you, Not while I'm around. Nothing's gonna harm you, darling, Not while I'm around. (He leans into her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demons'll charm you With a smile For a while, But in time Nothing's gonna harm you, Not while I'm around. The music continues as she holds him. There are tears in eyes. But we see that her gentle song has calmed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny we should be having this little chat right now ... 'Cause I was just thinkin', you know how you've always fancied coming into the bakehouse with me to help make the pies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. She quickly dries her eyes and then turns him to look at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ... no time like the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett leads Toby down the claustrophobic, long stai toward the bakehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart bleeds for you havin' to go up and down all these stairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that'll be your job now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am! She arrives at the heavy iron door to the bakehouse. We c hear the seismic rumble of the bake oven within. She unbolts the door and ushers Toby in. And we finally enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A macabre vision of Hell. The roof hangs low in this subterranean chamber. The gris tools of her trade are scattered about the place: a large stained chopping block; a meat grinder; buckets of questionable viscous liquid; cleavers and bone saws and m hooks; wet sewer grates for the blood. A metal sheet, hinged at the top, has been attached to co an opening in the wall: the mouth of the chute from the barber shop above.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And eeriest of all ... the thundering roar of flame comin from a large industrial oven against one wall. Toby takes in the cavernous bakehouse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coo, quite a stink, ain't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates the sewer grates:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those grates go right down to the sewers and the whiffs come up, always a few rats gone home to Jesus down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- where do I start?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him across to the thrumming, fiery oven:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this would be the bake oven ... Ten dozen at a time. Always be sure the doors is closed properly, like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to remember it all) Yes'm, always closed properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him to the meat grinder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here's the grinder ... (demonstrates it) ... You pop in the meat, give it a good grind and it comes out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (practicing with the grinder) Good grind, comes out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy. Smoothly, smoothly -- Now I've got to pop upstairs, back in two shakes, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes'm.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She begins to go. He stops her with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I might have a pie while I wait? She turns. He is standing at a rack of cooling pies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As many as you like, son ... As many as you like. She goes and shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans against the bakehouse door, tormented, gasping air. Then she slowly bolts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cacophony of madness. The ragged inmates of the asylum slammed together in a series of cramped cells, the low ceiling pressing down. We discover Anthony, dressed as a fashionable wigmaker, walking past the cells with the odious MR. FOGG. Fogg car a large pair of scissors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oh yes, sir, I agree it would be to our mutual interest to come to some arrangement in regard to my poor children's hair. He moves to one of the cells and unlocks it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep the blondes over here. It was yellow hair you was looking for, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Fogg goes into the crowded cell -- the inmates, all blond women, scurry back, clearly terrified of Fogg. Anthony se Johanna, wearing a filthy straitjacket, hunched like a fe animal, cowering in a corner of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one has hair the shade I need.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fogg goes to fetch Johanna, hauls her to Anthony:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, child. Smile for the gentleman and you shall have a sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna's eyes shoot wide when she sees Anthony, but she nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prepares scissors) Now, where shall I cut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Fogg can react -- Anthony pulls a revolver from hi clothing, grabs Johanna and pushes Fogg back into the cel He swings the cell door shut, locking Fogg in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word, Mr. Fogg, or it will be your last ... Now, I leave you to the mercy of your "children."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Johanna and pulls her away. Mr. Fogg turns. He is locked in with the blonde inmates. slowly begin to advance on him. Menacing. It is likely th are going to rip him limb from limb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd and Mrs. Lovett are hurrying down the stairs from th barber shop, urgent. Todd has a razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I got him locked in -- but if he escapes he'll go to the law!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he can't escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. T. -- I don't know -- maybe we could--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge will be here soon! I have no time, woman! Come on--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn a corner and walk straight into-- The Beadle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir! -- You gave me a fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my intention, good madam, though I am here on official business. (elaborately prepares a pinch of snuff) You see, there's been complaints. About the stink from your chimney. They say at night, it's something most foul. Health regulations -- and the general public welfare, naturally -- being my duty, I'm afraid I'll have to take a look ... (inhales the snuff, Sneezes and daintily wipes his nose) ... at your bakehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smoothly) Of course ... But first why don't you come upstairs and let me attend to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much as I do appreciate tonsorial adornment, I really ought see to my "official" obligations first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An admirable sentiment -- But I must ask you, out of professional curiosity you understand, is that a cream or a tallow pomade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his hair) Oh, not a pomade at all! Me secret is a touch of ambergris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sir, hair that delicate requires a genuine pomade! Come along, let me show you the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering) Well ... you are the expert in these matters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we'll finish you off with a nice facial rub of bay rum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, bay rum is bracing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all on the house, for my friend, Beadle Bamford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, I take that very kindly ... Lead on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, sir, entirely at your -- (his eyes flit to Mrs. Lovett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- disposal. He leads the Beadle away. Mrs. Lovett allows herself a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the street, we see Todd leading the Beadle up stairs to the barber shop, chatting with him easily. We realize we are seeing the perspective of the Beggar Wo hunched across the street, watching them closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby is eating a pie as he slowly wanders around the bakehouse. He stops to consider the many stained cleavers and bone s curious. Then he bites on something hard -- stops -- he reaches in his mouth and pulls something out. Looks at it: It is a fingernail. To be exact, it is the severed tip of a finger. Toby drops it in horror and starts back-- Suddenly, a loud THUMPING and CLANGING makes him spin, alarmed--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As -- The bloody body of the Beadle EXPLODES SUDDENLY from the mouth of the chute-- Toby screams and races to the door-- Pulls at it. Locked. No use. He bangs on the heavy iron d wildly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. LOVETT! MRS. LOVETT! LET ME OUT! MRS. LOVETT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thundering roar from the bake oven seems to rise to m his frenzy as-- In panic, Toby races to the sewer grate, yanks it up and disappears down into the sewers as the shrill factory whi SCREAMS and we cut to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd stands by the chair, his razor high-- His eyes blazing-- His face covered in a spray of blood-- Lost in rapture. Not for long. The Gentleman, the Banker, the General move into the fram with purpose, impatient. The Gentleman flicks out his handkerchief and begins to c the blood off Todd's face -- he is not gentle, the blood smears--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine roared, the motor hissed, And who could see how the road would twist...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the Banker pulls off Todd's stained barber tun and hands Todd his jacket--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Sweeney's ledger the entries matched: A Beadle arrived, and a Beadle dispatched...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the General is cleaning up the blood on the ba chair--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To satisfy the hungry god Of Sweeney Todd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Demon Barber of Fleet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY -- a sharp cry from across the room -- Todd spin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWEENEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd sees that more and more of the ghastly specters are moving around the room -- multiplying exponentially -- we the TOURIST, the STUDENT, the PRIEST and others. They are more intrusive than they have ever been -- touch Todd -- eagerly preparing him for the finale of his drama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (variously) Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now the ghosts are fully Furies, demented and threaten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeney! Sweeeeeeneeeeey...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screeching music transforms into a strange symphony o inarticulate moans and howls and chants, taking us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeneeeeeeeeeeeey... Sweeneysweeneysweeneysweeney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd and Mrs. Lovett are searching for Toby through a horrible catacomb of decaying sewers. Todd carries a razo Their voices echo bizarrely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby! Where are you, love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby! Where are you, lad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's gonna harm you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not while I'm around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's gonna harm you, Darling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to be afraid of boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not while I'm around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demons are prowling everywhere Nowadays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music takes us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony and Johanna hurry into the barber shop. She is no dressed as a scruffy boy, a cap hiding her hair. She is distracted and disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Todd...? No matter. You wait for him here -- I'll return with the coach in less than half an hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently touches Todd's collection of razors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, darling, in those clothes, no one will recognize you ... You're safe now.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She picks up the largest razor, looks at it, an eerie ech her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (darkly ironic) Safe ... So we run away and then all our dreams come true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never had dreams. Only nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna ... When we're free of this place all the ghosts will go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him very intensely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Anthony, they never go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gently touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back to you ... Half an hour and we'll be free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes. She turns to the window, watches him go. Her expression i sad: he will never fully comprehend her depth. Then she sees the Beggar Woman approaching from across th street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beggar Woman begins climbing the stairs to the barber shop:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beadle ... Beadle ... No good hiding, I saw you! Are you in there still?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna hears the Beggar Woman singing, climbing the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beadle ... Beadle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna looks around urgently, sees the large chest. She quickly climbs into it and shuts the lid as-- The Beggar Woman enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beadle dear, Beadle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has a strange effect on her, as if she were vagu recalling some distant dream. She intones to pretty lulla music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beadle deedle deedle deedle deedle dumpling, Beadle, dumpling, Be-deedle dumpling...

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY--
dialogues.text: Without warning -- like a thunderbolt -- Todd leaps into room--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching at his arm) Ah, evil is here, sir. The stink of evil -- from below -- from her! ... (calling) ... Beadle dear, Beadle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks anxiously out the window for the Judge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet, woman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still clutching at him) She's the Devil's wife! Oh, beware her, sir. She with no pity ... (slowing, looking at him more closely) ...in her heart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of here! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really peering at him now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't I know you, mister? Todd suddenly sees -- the Judge! -- walking toward the sh Todd has no time--! The music THUNDERS as-- In one brutal motion -- he swings around and grabs his ra - fiercely SLASHES her throat -- tosses her in the chair pulls the lever -- she slides through the floor-- He pulls the chair back to its normal position just as-- The Judge enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, your Honor. With my neighbor. Thank heavens the sailor did not molest her. Thank heavens, too, she has seen the error of her ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, sir, your lesson was well learned. She speaks only of you, longing for forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she shall have it. She'll be here soon, you say? The music builds, the pace increases:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I hear her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, excellent, my friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that her dainty footstep on the stair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, isn't that her shadow on the wall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Primping, Making herself even prettier than usual--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even prettier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blissful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhhh, Pretty women!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women, yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straightening his coat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, sir, a splash of bay rum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit, sir, sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (settling into chair, in lecherous rapture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanna, Johanna... Todd gets a towel, puts it carefully around the Judge, mo to get a bottle of bay rum--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women Are a wonder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a merry mood again today, barber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joyfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we do for They sing simultaneously as Todd smoothes bay rum on the Judge's face and then reaches for his razor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women! Blowing out their candles Combing out their hair-- Then they leave-- Even when they leave you And vanish, they somehow Can still remain There with you there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty women! Blowing out their candles Or combing out their hair, Even when they leave, They still Are there, They're there... The music builds dangerously as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How seldom it is one meets a fellow spirit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With fellow tastes -- in women, at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The years no doubt have changed me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TODD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then, I suppose the face of a barber -- the face of a prisoner in the dock -- is not particularly memorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a horrified realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin Barker!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN BARKER
dialogues.text: The factory whistle screams a steady, terrible blast as-- Todd brutally SLASHES the Judge's throat-- Severing his jugular-- The spray of blood drenches Todd-- He pulls the lever and sends the body tumbling out of sig down the chute.
