The music continues... As Todd stands for a long moment, blood dripping from his face, exalted. Then he sinks to his knees, overcome. The music stops. A long beat of silence. Then Todd looks at his razor deeply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest now, my friend, Rest now forever, Sleep now the untroubled Sleep of the angels. Then silence as he reverently sets the razor on the floor looks at it. We focus on his face. His quest is completed. His demons silenced. The ghosts are gone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's done. He just kneels there. No reason to move. No purpose in li Then... A sound from the chest. A slight thump. His eyes dart to the chest. He slowly picks up his razor and moves to the chest. Then suddenly WRENCHES it open and HAULS out Johanna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (darkly) Come for a shave, have you, lad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses her in the chair, throws back his arm, his razo ready--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely, yes! Everyone needs a good shave--!

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett's voice -- screaming to raise the dead-- Todd rivets Johanna, pointing the razor at her, a lethal warning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins and bolts out of the shop, leaving her sitting i the chair--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett is standing in horror by the mouth of the chu The Judge, still barely alive, clutches at her skirt-- She tries to wrench herself away from his vise-like grip-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die! Die! God in heaven -- die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge's fingers finally relax their grip; he is dead. Panting, Mrs. Lovett, backs away from him and for the fir time notices the body of the Beggar Woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Can it be? Have all the demons of Hell come to torment me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the Beggar Woman and starts dragging her quickl toward the oven as Todd races in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you scream? Does the Judge live still?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was clutching, holding on to my dress, but he's finished now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues quickly dragging the Beggar Woman toward th oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave them to me. Open the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves her toward the oven--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't touch her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the doors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her toward the oven and leans over to pick up t Beggar Woman's body--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you? It's only a silly old beggar--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then -- Mrs. Lovett opens the oven doors-- The thundering roar from the oven crashes through the roo the fiery light slashes across the floor-- Clearly illuminating the face of the Beggar Woman. A chord of music as Todd realizes who she is. Music conti and builds as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! ... Oh God ... "Don't I know you?" she said ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to Mrs. Lovett:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew she lived. From the moment that I came into your shop you knew my Lucy lived!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only thinking of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Lucy! A crazy hag picking bones and rotten spuds out of alley ashcans! Would you have wanted to know she ended up like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, not lied at all. No, I never lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beggar Woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said she took the poison -- she did -- Never said that she died -- Poor thing, She lived--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come home again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it left her weak in the head, All she did for months was just lie there in bed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've been in hospital, Wound up in Bedlam instead, Poor thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better you should think she was dead. (passionately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I lied 'cos I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be twice the wife she was! I love you! Could that thing have cared for you Like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a harrowing keen)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT HAVE I DONE
dialogues.text: Todd's eyes suddenly snap up to Mrs. Lovett -- as the glorious "Little Priest" waltz theme returns--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lovett, You're a bloody wonder, Eminently practical and yet Appropriate as always, As you've said repeatedly, There's little point in dwelling on the past. He steps toward her, she steps back, unsure, as they sing simultaneously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, come here, my love... Not a thing to fear, My love... What's dead Is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mean it? Everything I did I swear I thought Was only for the best, Believe me! (a heartbreaking plea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we still be Married? Todd steps toward her darkly.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She knows she is doomed. But steps into his arms anyway for a final, triumphant wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The history of the world, my pet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mr. Todd, Ooh, Mr. Todd, Leave it to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is learn forgiveness and try to forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the lost dream)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the sea, Mr. Todd, We'll be comfy-cozy, By the sea, Mr. Todd, Where there's no one nosy... He waltzes her toward the roaring oven. She offers no resistance, fully aware of what's coming. The blazing, thundering inferno of the oven makes it seem they are the damned, dancing through Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And life is for the alive, my dear, So let's keep living it--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep living it, Really living it--! The music reaches a thundering crescendo as-- He flings her into the oven and slams the doors-- We hear her screaming. And banging on the oven doors. Todd sinks to his knees and covers his ears desperately a the banging and screaming and music finally fade to silen Then he slowly drags himself across the floor to the Begg Woman. He cradles her head in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a barber and his wife, And she was beautiful. A foolish barber and his wife, She was his reason and his life. And she was beautiful. And she was virtuous. And he was... Todd folds himself over his dead wife. The only sound his deep, anguished sobs. A long beat. Then he becomes aware of something. He looks over to see. Toby -- staring at him from the open sewer grate. He has everything. Todd watches as Toby silently pulls himself up. Todd gent sets Lucy down and then, still kneeling, turns to face To A long beat as they look at each other. Then Toby slowly moves and carefully picks up Todd's razo Todd looks at him. Then slowly unbuttons his collar and exposes his neck. He bends his head back, offering his naked throat. Toby slowly goes to him and methodically slits his throat Todd continues to gaze up at Toby as we hear the lonely s of wind escaping from his severed wind pipe. Then Toby turns and leaves the bakehouse. Todd leans forward, dying. We cut to his point-of-view: The rough brick floor... From the bottom of the frame... A dark pool of blood slowly begins to spread ... moving u the frame ... the fiery glow from the bake oven reflected the blood...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Finally, the pool of blood fills the entire frame. We realize this is the first image we saw in the story. Todd's perspective. Todd's blood. As he dies. As before, the Gentleman's face appears, reflected in the pool of blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd, His skin was pale and his eye was odd. The Banker emerges from the shadows of the bakehouse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shaved the faces of gentlemen Who never thereafter were heard of again. The General emerges ... and the Tourist ... and the Pries ... and the Student...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (variously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trod a path that few have trod, Did Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. Then a new ghost ... a face we recognize ... the Beggar Woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kept a shop in London town, Of fancy clients and good renown. She is joined by the Judge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if none of their souls were saved? They went to their maker impeccably shaved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Sweeney, By Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. The Beadle and Pirelli join the ghosts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing your razor wide, Sweeney! Hold it to the skies! Freely flows the blood of those Who moralize!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ghosts move around the bakehouse, considering the mea grinder and stained cleavers and chopping block...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (variously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His needs are few, his room is bare. He hardly uses his fancy chair. The more he bleeds, the more he lives. He never forgets and he never forgives. Perhaps today you gave a nod To Sweeney Todd. The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. Hunting like predators, we begin to move urgently through ghosts. Their long shadows tower bizarrely against the wa and ceiling of the bakehouse. The fiery red roar of the b oven builds in intensity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (variously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeney wishes the world away, Sweeney's weeping for yesterday, Hugging the blade, waiting the years, Hearing the music that nobody hears. Sweeney waits in the parlor hall, Sweeney leans on the office wall. No one can help, nothing can hide you-- Isn't that Sweeney there beside you? Sweeney wishes the world away, Sweeney's weeping for yesterday, Is Sweeney! There he is, it's Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! We tear through them with increasing frenzy -- cutting quickly, vertiginous angles -- as the music builds--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (variously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! There! There! There! There! There! There! (almost a scream now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! They move away-- Revealing-- Todd and Mrs. Lovett. Facing each other. We circle them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd! He served a dark and a hungry god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply to Mrs. Lovett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To seek revenge may lead to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But everyone does it, if seldom as well--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --As Sweeney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sweeney Todd... The Demon Barber of Fleet... The ghosts begin to disappear ... fading into the shadows the bakehouse ... leaving Todd and Mrs. Lovett alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Street! The febrile music continues as Todd and Mrs. Lovett stand alone, continuing to glare at each other. Finally she gives him a grim little smile and disappears the darkness. He stands alone. And we cut to-- A series of images from earlier in our story, cut to the Todd's life flashing before his eyes -- The images building as the music races toward its conclus Todd singing -- slashing -- smiling -- striding-- The final crash of music at the final image: Todd kneeling, hunched over the pool of blood on the bakehouse floor. He falls... Into the blood. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Snap to black. The End
